string.text: Hey, Barkeep, do you have anything to drink?
It's on the house, thanks to Shining.
Barkeep, how was your trip back the mainland?
There's nothing good about that place.
Why do you say that? Didn't you have any luck there?
Why don't you call the mainland and find out?
I can make a call? To the mainland? Come on.
Climb on to the roof, jump across to the next, from there take the stairs to the tower. Only don't break the bell!
Well... you amaze me.
Okay, I'm only kidding. Help yourself to a beer.
I see you have a deck of cards... Do you want to play for money?
With pleasure! I'm bored here. We can play "21". Can you remember how to play?
Remind me of the rules.
I know how to play.

The rules are simple. To win at "21" need to get 21 points. Points are calculated as follows: cards 2 to 10 - according to face value, Jack - 2 points, Queen - 3 points, King - 4 points. Ace can have a higher value, in our case, the ace - 11 points.\nMaximum bet - 5000, minimum bet - 500. That's all, nothing complicated.
Roger, let's play.
I changed my mind, I don't want to play.
Well, as you wish. Come back, when you want to play.
Sounds boring. Is there something which is fun?
We can play the "Find the ball" game. It's fun, but we play for money. If you forgot the rules - I can remind you. Play?
I know how to play.
Tell me the rules.
I don't want to play.

I'll put a ball under one of the three cups, then mix them, to confuse you. - Your task is to guess under which cup is the ball. The minimum bet - 500, maximum bet - 2000. Rules - there aren't any!\nWell, shall we will play
Listen, I was given a task...
...and you're having some difficulties with it, that's why you came to me?
Yes. I need the access codes to the X-18 lab. I can't find them...
Well, actually, I could help you... For adequate remuneration. Let's say, 50 thousand.
It's expensive, but I have no choice. Here.
I don't have the money. I'll come back later.

Excellent. Here's what I know about the X-18: Access to the laboratory is divided into two levels - one for junior and one senior staff. The levels are separated by heavy coded doors, there are codes for each corresponding level. The code of the first level is - 1243. Code for a second level is - 9524. Remember it, as I won't tell you a second time.
Well, this is what I need. Thank you.
Help me to deal with the bandits.
And what affairs do you have with them? Do you have money?
I have business with Borov. And yes, I have money.

Good. Pay me 30,000 roubles. I'll give you a introductory letter: I will say that you have important business with Borov. The bandits won't touch you for the day. But bear in mind that the neutrality term is limited. If you don't go, the bandits will no longer talk to you. And yes, as soon as your affairs in the Dark Valley are finalised - the neutrality will end.
OK, I understand. Take the money.
I changed my mind.
Tell me about your group.
Our group is called "Duty".
Why such a name?
Why, you ask? Well, it's simple. If not us, then who? Our duty - is to fight all the manifestations in the Zone.
Go on.

Many of our guys come into the Zone as normal stalkers wanting to cash in, but just seeing the local horror, they realized that something must be done to stop this. Now, they give up the good life, if only to keep the mutants out of their home towns.
It's a pity really, that not all people think the same. And it sucks that we have to deal with a bunch of idiots, to prevent the spread of the Zone.
Well, if I find any - I'll bring them.

The radio receives too much strong interference due to the Zone. There is an old jukebox here, but it doesn't have any records. You walk around a lot in the Zone - look around, see if you can find any music records - bring them back, and we can all listen together.
Barkeep, why is it so quiet in the bar, why is there no music?
Could you help me to restore relations with Duty? I don't want to quarrel with them.
You shouldn't have picked a fight with them. So, now I have to sort out the nonsense you've caused. The cost will depend on how much damage you've caused. And compensation for my time, he he.
And what is the payment for your services?
Well. You didn't cause much harm, so you can get rid of the problem, if you pay 10,000 roubles.
Eh. You seriously annoyed them. Such a situation will not attract a small fee. I can sort out your problems for 30,000 roubles.
You really pissed them off. Duty are ready to destroy the Bar just to kill you. Solving your problem will be very difficult, but, if you pay 80,000 roubles, I can fix it.
I agree to pay as much as you need.
To hell with Duty! I'll cope with these nut bags somehow.
Could you help me restore relations with Freedom? I'm tired of their persecution.
Alas, at the moment, I can't help you.
I can assist you. You didn't cause much harm, so I can get rid of your problem, if you pay me 10,000 roubles.
Yes, you left some considerably marks. For such a situation the fee is not small. I can settle your problems for 30,000 roubles.
You've really ruffled some feathers this time. Solve your problem will be very difficult, but it's possible, if you pay 80,000 roubles.
I'll pay whatever is necessary.
To hell with Freedom. They're not worth that kind of money.
Barkeep, I have business, you understand...Duty are quite insolent, they won't let me pass through to the Garbage. Can you help me?

It would be a sin not to help a good man. For a fee, of course. 40,000 roubles - and gates for you will always be open. You will be able to pass like a normal person, and not have to dodge radioactive piles.
Forty thousand? Damn it, that's too much. All right, take it!

Alright then. Well, Duty simply won't open the door. You'll need to by-pass their post somehow, without letting them see you. Then you will have a free path. But, I will warn them about you in advance.
Why should I pay so much... I'll find a way to go around.
Go on...

So, your first fight? Your opponent is a piece of meat just like you. He's here because of debts and he only has two options: to come out and fight or to land himself in the nearest anomaly. He's going to fight like a cornered animal. Equipment for today... let me think... OK! Why don't you two use PMm's...two clips each should be plenty. Either you kick his ass or we feed you to the dogs - not much of a choice. Go on now.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Your last fight didn't mean shit. You're still the same piece of meat you were before and no self-respecting person will bet a single mag on you. If you want to earn some proper cash you're going to have to make a few more appearances in the arena. Your new opponent also got through the first round and his fight was a lot harder than yours. I don't like him, to be honest - he kills too quickly and the crowd doesn't like that. So, go and show us what you can do! The stakes will increase after this fight - all you've got to do is stay alive. Move it!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, well... You're not as much of a pussy as you first seemed. Now it's time to test you out in a real fight. You're up against two guys. The first one's called Swede and I don't remember the second one's name. They were paired up intentionally as they hate each other's guts so don't worry about them working as a team - they're more likely to shoot each other. Today is rifle day so don't let them get too close or we'll have to pick you up piece by piece. The odds are 10:1 so if you win you'll make a fair amount. Off you go!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, now I can safely say that you're a fighter, a real fighter. Now it's time for a team fight. You get to fight with two rookies - two brothers - on your side. They haven't fought yet but they're brothers, so I had to put them into a team fight. I wouldn't expect any real help from them if I were you. You're fighting an experienced team, they're contenders for the final this season. A dangerous lot. They use different weapons but one has an automatic shotgun - be very careful with him. Good luck, pal... you're gonna need it.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

You've got a special fight today. Even the army has heard about you! Don't be surprised, they fight here too - there's even a general in the crowd. These guys are from the Spetsnaz or from OMON. They're well armed and their armour is good as you'd expect. Don't worry though, I'm not going to leave you out in the rain, either. You'll get a vest used by Freedom - it's light so it won't slow you down. Go on, show them that stalkers aren't whipping boys. Good luck!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Time for you to show what you can do. Duty captured a group of bandits that had been causing problems for stalkers near Rostok. Duty took them at night so most of the bandits were taken alive. They were all going to be executed anyway so I convinced Duty to give them a chance. If any of them survive, they'll go in the can outside the Zone, which is better than dying here. They're not well-armed - just a few pistols and sawn-off's - but there's six of them so watch yourself. Go on now!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, you're almost in the final. Now you'll be fighting a real stalker. He's alone but he's got an FT 200M and he's inside an exoskeleton. Catch one burst and you're toast. There will be a surprise that I can't tell you about too... Here's my advice: be prepared, it's going to be tough. The winner makes it through to the final. Fight to the death, go!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Congratulations, you're in the final! One more to go and this one is to the death, every man for himself. There will be 4 other stalkers in the arena: all real pros in exoskeletons with GP-37s but it's a fair deal this time - you'll get exactly what they have. The only thing is, you don't get med kits or bandages in a fight to the death. Ready? Go prove you're the best, GO!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Congratulations, Marked One, you are now the champion, I haven't found a worthy contender yet to challenge your title, I suggest, don't relax but continue to perform in the Arena. How about taking on a few mutants? We just got in a new batch.
Let's see...
Choose who fight and we will begin.
Knackery
At last we have a supply of wild beasts, there are even some very rare specimens. Well, which will you try first?
Dogs
Tushkanos
Snorks
Bloodsuckers
Controller and zombies
Chimeras
Burers
Pseudogiant
Fight with warriors
Fight with mercenaries
Fight with Freedom
Fight with Duty
Well, tell me, how many of the soldier's livers do you want for your dog today?
Choose how much meat you want at this time.
Yes, they are fresh, very fresh ... how many pieces do you want?
Duty. Today, they will do their duty and kick the bucket. How many of them will it be - you decide.
One on one
Two against one
Three against one
Bloodbath
Tote

Well then, Marked One, today we announced two exclusive bouts, namely the military against the mercenaries and Duty against Freedom. Each side will have six representatives, all of them seasoned fighters and equipped accordingly. The winners will go into the finals, where they will compete for the title of the coolest group of the week with some privileges. For each of the parties, victory is essential, so they will fight like animals, so make the right choice.
I'll bet on the military
I'll bet on the mercenaries
I'll bet on Freedom
I'll bet on Duty
The final battle
Today in the finals are the military and Freedom. Well, you saw what they can do, so place your bets, gentlemen.
Today in the finals are Duty and the military. Well, you saw what they can do, so place your bets, gentlemen.
Today in the finals are Freedom and the mercenaries. Well, you saw what they can do, so place your bets, gentlemen.
Today in the finals are Duty and the mercenaries. Well, you saw what they can do, so place your bets, gentlemen.
Well, for the military. How much did you want to bet?
So, bet on the mercenaries. How much?
How much do you want to put on Freedom?
How many roubles will you bet on Duty?
I'll bet 3,000 roubles.
I'll bet 8,000 roubles.
I'll bet 12,000 roubles.
I'm not ready.
I changed the mind, I will come after pay day.
I'm busy, I'll come back later.
Yo! I've got a new fight for you.
Take a walk for an hour or two, the Arena isn't ready yet!
You've become a master!
Here, take what you earned.
Next please!
The Arena is closed for maintenance. So take a little walk, until 22:00. I'll announce the opening on the general channel.
Excellent, Marked One. As you can see, the arena is again ready for you to sprinkle the walls with fresh blood. Come on, hurry up and choose a fight! Today we have, as always, a very intense program.
See you...
You are not experienced enough for this fight!
Here is the flash drive I got from professor Kruglov.
Good job, I think, Duty will be grateful for this information. Here's a reward.

So. Information, you say? Directly from professor Kruglov, huh? Are you trying to mock me? "I, Professor Kruglov, in the name of science and humanity, have erased our research reports." - Is this the information that you brought? Yeah ... I think, Duty will be very "happy" when they find out about this.
Mission accomplished. Here's Tyran's PDA.
Wow, Marked One. Great job! What can I say? You made me happy, man. I wasn't sure you'd manage, to be honest...but you're alive and they're not!
What about the reward?
Here you go, as promised - your reward.
Here is Lucky's PDA. I did what you asked.
Nice, Marked One. Great job! What can I say? You made me happy, man. I wasn't sure you'd manage, to be honest...but you're alive and they're not!
What about the reward?
You're a hero, man, a real hero. Here, this should make you happy.
Are there any special mission?
No, nothing today.
Get to the point. What should be done?
No, nothing today.

I've got a serious mission. A group of veteran killers has showed up in the Wild Territory again. Some Duty people came to me and asked me to deal with these veterans. Duty has solid proof that they are responsible for the deaths of solo stalkers. The problem is that these veterans and Duty have some old agreement and Duty can't break it but these guys are really pushing it. Basically, Duty wants them taken out, nice and quiet. It isn't going be easy but the job pays well.
Any other additional conditions? It's strange that Duty sinks this low.
Duty values its reputation. Therefore, they want it done covertly. You need to destroy their leader, named "Lucky" and bring his PDA as evidence.
I'll do it. I hope that I won't regret it.
A good decision, there's nothing to regret.
No, I won't do it.
Well, as you wish... Just remember, this is a good opportunity to get appreciation from Duty.
Get to the point. What should be done?

Your mission - is to kill Tyran, the leader of the mercenaries. His crew made it into the Wild Territory and set up a base at the construction site. Be careful, some of their fighters have set up ambushes on the way to the site. As soon as you bring me Tyran's PDA - you'll get your reward.
I'll do it. I hope I won't regret it.
A good decision, there's nothing to regret.
No, I won't do it.
Well, as you wish.
No, nothing today.

Your mission - is to kill Tyran, the leader of the mercenaries. His crew made it into the Wild Territory and set up a base at the construction site. Be careful, some of their fighters have set up ambushes on the way to the site. As soon as you bring me Tyran's PDA - you'll get your reward.
I'll do it. I hope I won't regret it.
A good decision, there's nothing to regret.
No, I won't do it.
Well, as you wish.
No, nothing today.
Don't hurry, Marked One. You haven't dealt with the veterans yet, and you're already keen to do something else.
No, nothing today.

I've got a serious mission. A group of veteran killers has showed up in the Wild Territory again. Some Duty people came to me and asked me to deal with these veterans. Duty has solid proof that they are responsible for the deaths of solo stalkers. The problem is that these veterans and Duty have some old agreement and Duty can't break it but these guys are really pushing it. Basically, Duty wants them taken out, nice and quiet. It isn't going be easy but the job pays well.
Any additional conditions?
Duty values its reputation. Therefore, they want it done covertly. You need to destroy their leader, named "Lucky" and bring his PDA as evidence.
I'll do it.
A good decision, there's nothing to regret.
No, I won't do it.
Well, as you wish... Just remember, this is a good opportunity to get appreciation from Duty.
default text

Your mission - is to kill Tyran, the leader of the mercenaries. His crew made it into the Wild Territory and set up a base at the construction site. Be careful, some of their fighters have set up ambushes on the way to the site. As soon as you bring me Tyran's PDA - you'll get your reward.
I'll do it..
A good decision, there's nothing to regret.
No, I won't do it.
Well, as you wish.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
Not yet, another time.
I've got a job for a professional.
Get to the point. What should be done?

Your mission - is to kill Tyran, the leader of the mercenaries. His crew made it into the Wild Territory and set up a base at the construction site. Be careful, some of their fighters have set up ambushes on the way to the site. As soon as you bring me Tyran's PDA - you'll get your reward.
Understood. I hope I won't regret it.
A good decision, there's nothing to regret.
No, I won't do it.
Well, as you wish.
No, I'm not interested.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
Well, shall we? Ready?
Hmm... What are you still doing here?
Well, marked one, do you have the documents from the X-16?
Yes, here they are.
No.
Get them, damn you. Here I am, busting my ass, bending over backwards for you, and you let me down. Get those damn documents! Without them, we won't make any progress!
Okay.
Well, Marked One, all that remains now, is to turn off the "brain scorcher" and open a passage to the North. Are you ready to go?
I'm ready.

Well then, Marked One, you have the prototype protective helmet to protect yourself from the brain scorcher. The coordinates to the bunker, I know. Don't forget that the prototype can't protect you indefinitely from the radiation. You should get into the bunker under the antennas, and disable the scorcher as quickly as possible. I don't know what will happen next, but I feel that it's worth it! I know for one thing for sure - the road to the centre of the Zone will be open.
Go on.
All you have to do - is to get to the bunker under the antennas and disable them. All clear?
Clear.

Yes, there's another thing! The leader of Duty, I marked him on the map, needs a volunteer to perform some task at a the Army Warehouses, if you're interested, you can go and see him. I'll arrange with security to let you in.
No, I'm not ready yet.
Well get ready, Marked One! This task can't wait!

OK, the documents you brought from the Institute make some things a little clearer but we're still missing the info we need to get a full picture. A lab designated X18 is mentioned and its description matches the abandoned underground vaults in the Dark Valley. Looks like you'll have to go there and get the info we need. The lab is closed and you'll need two electronic keys to get inside. I'll give you one but you'll have to get the other one from Borov in the Dark Valley.
Go on.

All you have to do is acquire the second key to Lab X18, get inside and retrieve the second batch of documents. Don't forget to get yourself a protective suit or you won't have a chance in hell of getting to the lab. So, will you do it?
I'll try.
Great! I'll be waiting.
No, I don't want to do it yet.
Up to you but remember: this is the only way that can help us open the road to the North.
What do you want, Marked One?
Hey, Marked One! Times change but you're still grumpy and aloof. Here, take a seat, have a drink - maybe you'll mellow a bit.
So, Marked One, you brought the documents from X18?
Yeah. Here.

Good, the situation is becoming clearer. As I expected this Brain Scorcher is man-made. It's a Kaymanov experimental emitter and its components were manufactured in the X18. These documents refer to the X16 lab where they sent some components. According to this, the X16 is located in the production complex area by Lake Yantar. The scientists have set up a mobile lab around there so maybe they can help.
Go on.
The situation is difficult: You need to get to the scientists and find out where the X16 is so you can get the missing documents. So, you up for it?
Yeah.
Great! I'll be waiting.
No, I'm not ready yet.
Well get ready real quick Marked One! This sort of business can't wait.
No.
What are you wasting time for? Go get those damn documents or we won't make any progress!
What do you want, Marked One?
Hey, Marked One! Times change but you're still grumpy and aloof. Here, take a seat, have a drink - maybe you'll mellow a bit.
Hey, Marked One! Have you brought the documents from the Agroprom?
No, I haven't got the documents yet.

That's not good, Marked One, not good at all... You understand how much we need them, don't you? We need them real bad, believe me. The Brain Scorcher is right under our noses but we don't even know what it is! Go get the documents right now - we'll talk after that.
I think I understand.
Here are the documents from the Agroprom.

Great work, Marked One! We have the documents at last. I need to have a look at them now and maybe I'll work out how to get North. While I do that, if you have problems with money, you can fight at the Arena. The owner of the Arena is Arnie, I've uploaded his coordinates.
OK.
Now listen up!
What do you want, Marked One?
Hey, Marked One! Times change but you're still grumpy and aloof. Here, take a seat, have a drink - maybe you'll mellow a bit.
I want to know something.
What is it?
Thank you.
What do you know about Strelok?

An experienced stalker as far as I know. He used to "work" through the northern exits from the Zone. He was hardly ever seen here but there are rumours that he took his group right into the centre of the Zone.
What do you know about a stalker they call Ghost?

He's one of Strelok's men. They say he can sneak in anywhere without being noticed. I heard that he took out the leader of some crazy group... what was the name? Ah, 'Last Days', that's the one. They were pretty wild those boys... Oh, by the way, I heard that Ghost is doing some job for the scientists, so if you're looking for him try the mobile lab at Lake Yantar.
He's an old stalker in retirement. He lives in the marshes, I'll mark it on the map for you. He used to be in Strelok's group back in the day.
What do you know about a stalker called Fang?

There was a man that went by that name, spoke with a lisp... He was a bit weird, that's for sure - talked to himself and stuff... but he seemed like an okay guy. I haven't seen him at the Bar for ages.
Tell me about the mobile science labs.

Scientists set them up from time to time. Isolated metal bunkers with everything you need to live. We're in contact with one of these labs in Yantar. Scientists are good guys - they tell us a lot of interesting things and we help them out when we can... An exchange of sorts...
What is the "wish granter"?
Oh! That's an interesting question... I wish I knew the answer. I can tell you the legend about the Granter if you want but you make up your own mind how much truth there's in it. Want to hear it?
Well, that's very interesting.

This legend is about the Monolith, which may be what caused the Zone to appear. When the Zone exploded in 2006, they evacuated people living near it and the Zone itself was cordoned off by the Army. Everyone was panicking, nobody knew what was going on, the Zone was expanding and the field labs couldn't do anything! Loads of people died there. Everyone was afraid of the radiation which could affect half of Europe. After a few years had passed, some reckless guys like you appeared. They called themselves stalkers. They started to sneak past army cordons believing that there are things in the Zone that would make them rich. Bit by bit, they brought out weird things, artefacts and which eventually turned out a race for them. Scientists went after them like crazy. They paid fantastic money for just one trinket back then, not like now.
Go on...

After a while, the first tales and legends about what's deep inside the Zone by the tumbledown nuclear power plant started to circulate. It was also then that one of the veterans told us the story of Monolith that allegedly grants your wishes. You should have seen the hysteria: experienced, level-headed men started trying to break through to the centre - everyone wanted something from the Monolith. We got some morbid details about the first stalker who made it through to the Monolith...
Go on... tell me more...

When the Zone had just appeared many people were trapped inside and cut off from the outside world. Most of them died pretty quickly but there were a few lucky survivors who tried to do something about it. One of these survivors found himself by the station and noticed some strange light inside. With no way back he decided to try to get closer. He saw the broken roof of the sarcophagus and the light coming out through it. He climbed up the wall and looked inside. Among the debris of metal and molten concrete there lay a massive black rock. It was the Monolith. The stalker managed to shake off the "spell" and realised that he had climbed very close to the sarcophagus, which was highly radioactive. He was scared to death but through the fear he could sense the Monolith calling to him. The Monolith called to him and he came to see strange, unbelievable things about the Monolith inside his head...
Cool...

I don't know what's true in this story and what's not but the point is the guy made a wish which came true, while the Zone grew by 5 kilometres. It seems the Zone gobbles up more land for every wish that is granted... But that isn't going to stop hotshots like you. They keep trying to break through with their precious little wishes in their hearts...
I'm more interested in other things at the moment.
That's your business, man. What exactly do you want to know?

Hic... damn it! Yes, I'm drunk, I'm drunk! They want...they... want to kick me out of Duty if I fail this task too...you know? But I'm not...hic...not feeling too...hic...good at the moment...you know...
I feel for you..
What's up? Any news? You haven't whacked the little piece of shit, I can see it in your eyes. Life sucks... Listen, at least have a drink with me, will you, friend?
Man...hic...you... you... you helped me! Let's drink to Duty... I guess! And...Oh!
I found it. Here is your rifle.

Wow?! You found my rifle?! I'm lost for words, man! Thank you so much! THANK YOU! I'm so grateful! You really helped me out here, you really did. Goddamn it. Here take this - it isn't much but it's all I got. I won't forget your help and I hope to repay you in time. Listen, I'll tell you something. There's a weird boarded-up house near that place you found my rifle. Nobody knows what's really inside it but you can see through the windows that there are anomalies there, lots of them. There might be artefacts in there too... I don't know how to get there though.
Go on.

I'll give you anything! Just return my rifle, I beg you. I lost it by that place where those damn bloodsuckers live. Here are the coordinates. Be careful though. Bloodsuckers aren't the friendly type.
OK, I'll try to get your rifle.
I wouldn't cheat you.
It's in your interest.
No. I've got more important things to do.
That's up to you... but I hope you change your mind.
We'll see.

I've got a big problem man! I... I lost my family rifle in the Wild Territory. I wanted to shoot some bloodsuckers but I barely got away. Damn! Listen, bro... if you get it back I'll pay you. I've made a little cash here and I'll give you all of it, just get my rifle back. It's a family rifle, you know, passed down from father to son... And I lost it! I've grown used to it, it's like an extension of my arm now...
Hey! Any news? Did you find it?
Thanks bro! I'll never forget that you helped me!
Wolfhound said you've got something for me.
Sure. Here is a grenade launcher for helping him with Kruglov, and 1000 cash on top. I'll give you some useful info for free to sweeten the deal too.
Thank you.

Here's what I got to say. You helped Freedom and made the right choice. Your fate is now tied with that of Freedom, and Duty has you in its sights. I'd say you ought to go to the abandoned military base and join the ranks of Freedom - they need good fighters. There will be shoot outs between the groups soon and whoever chooses the right side won't regret it.
I work as a dealer of information. I sell important info and buy charts, documents and lab records. My information is valuable and very useful to the one who possesses it!

Hello, Marked One. You helped Freedom and made the right choice. Your fate is now tied with that of Freedom and Duty has you in its sights. I'd suggest you go to the abandoned military base and join Freedom - they need good fighters.
I'll think about it.
So Marked One, what brings you here? Want to buy some information or are you selling today?
I hear you may have an interesting offer for me?

Yes Marked One, I do have... Incidentally, have you found any unusual bolts? They are the same as normal bolts which each stalker uses, only they shine in the dark as if illuminated from within. Fuck knows what other properties they possess besides luminescence... Well, there was a person, whose identity shall remain unknown, who came to me recently, he told me he was part of an expedition of scientists who had dug up such a bolt, somewhere. He was sure that obviously, there were more of these, not just one. Generally, I'm taking orders for 20 bolts at least, if you find more - great, bring them to me, but for lots of 20 bolts, you'll be well compensated... let's say, 30 thousand. The recompense for the bolts - in my opinion it's quite fair. Well, what do you say?
Well, okay, I've already scraped up a few bolts.
Well, I agree, I will attentively look around for these bolts.
No, not now, I'm not up to it.
About your your bolts...
Well, did you find some?
Here, just take it, I looked everywhere to collect them.
Yes, but not the desired number.
Yes, I found as many as I could.
I've found another bolt for you.
Have you decided to exceed the the amount of bolts?
Yes, take them, what am I owed for them?
No, I'm not ready to give them up, I may even need them.
So you're connected with Freedom then?
I can't answer that question right now. All I can say is that I am not a member of any group.
Tell me about the Freedom faction.

Sure, no problem! Freedom is one of the oldest groups in the Zone and the only one that openly opposes government troops and research teams. Its founders are dead - they were killed during a big bloodbath after the army dropped a large assault force in the Zone but the ability to control the Zone from outside was destroyed at the same time. There is some evidence to suggest that the first Zone was used as a secret army weapons' testing site. If that's true, they must have used some powerful shit.Anyway, what was I saying...? Oh yeah, Freedom is the only group that is trying to stop the government from gaining control over the testing site again. God knows what will happen if they start testing their shit again, so Freedom is trying to hold out at all costs.
What about Duty?

Duty is basically controlled from the outside by the government. Their current objective is to clear the territory of mutants and destroy Freedom, which is what they are doing at the moment. When the time is right, they will drop a large assault force in the Zone and take control of the area.
Thanks for the information.
I want to buy some information.
Right now, I can sell you information about Strelok's group virtually for nothing - 4000 roubles.
OK, I'll take it. Here's 4000.

It's located by the Agroprom Research Institute, there's a stash in the underground. It probably contains information about the group's plans and a list of group members. The coordinates of the stash are attached.
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you. Come to the bar when you decide otherwise - I'm always here.
Right now, I have some information about a group that made it to the centre of the Zone. I'm practically giving it away - only 5000 roubles.
OK, I'll buy it. Here's 5000.

Strelok, Ghost and Fang went to the centre of the Zone. What they found there, no one knows, but Strelok went missing while Ghost and Fang came back distraught.The latest news on Ghost is that he went to the mobile lab by Lake Yantar. Coordinates of the scientists' camp are attached.
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you. Come to the bar when you decide otherwise - I'm always here.
I've got some information about the secret of Lake Yantar. The price is just 5500 roubles - any less and I'd be paying you!
Okay, I'll buy it. Take 5500.

The secret of Lake Yantar is similar to the secret of the Brain Scorcher and their effects are similar in many ways. Some kind of emission zombifies all who come in contact with it. The zombified stalkers move around the centre of some emitter, attacking everyone. There is information to suggest that the solution to the riddle of Lake Yantar is below ground. Here are the coordinates of the emitter at Lake Yantar and those of the Brain Scorcher.
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you. Come to the bar when you decide otherwise - I'm always here.
I don't have any new information at the moment.
...it's about time someone whacked Borov! If I knew who it was, I'd buy him a drink.
Yeah, it was about time.
...someone really pissed off Freedom: I heard one of their groups was destroyed in the Wild Territory...I wonder who did it?
Yeah, I wish I knew...
...finally someone had the balls to clear out the bloodsuckers in the Wild Territory... What was Duty doing all this time?
What was Duty doing? They were doing Freedom, what else?
...I heard someone whacked the leader of Freedom. They're in for some tough times I think. Duty is going to really put a squeeze on them now...
Let's hope so.
So you wiped out those veterans? Well done, friend! Six stalkers went missing in that area recently... we all suspected those mad veterans. It's a good thing that they've been dealt with.
Yeah, many people wanted those veterans to "leave".

You turned off the emissions at Yantar? Wow...you're a lucky nut, damn it, I'm glad that someone finally managed to deal with that thing! You can't imagine how many of our boys died there... but now the scientists will work out what it was. We might even be able to deal with the Scorcher now...
I want to believe that the Scorcher can be switched off.
What do you want? Don't you see, I'm trying to relax here...
What's new?

I hear Strelok came back. He's got all the equipment you need to get to the Machine... He's hiding now though 'cause a lot of people are after him. Some are open about it while others are trying to keep their interest a secret. Rumour has it even Duty and Freedom have joined the hunt... each with their own agenda.
Looks like Strelok is right to hide.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

Useful to a rookie? Well, listen up. To the North, not far from the Brain Scorcher, Freedom have set up their HQ in an old military base. They're notorious nihilists, anarchists and criminals - freedom fighters, freaking guerrillas all of them. All they do is sabotage research groups, attack army units and constantly skirmish with Duty. These skirmishes are now spilling over into a small-scale war for survival. Let me give you some advice: never get involved with them. They'll only accept you if you're totally crazy and there's a reward on your head. Ha-ha-ha. Can you believe that?
Thanks for your advice.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

Well, there used to be this group led by Strelok. There were all sorts of legends about it going around the Zone... good and bad, but few people really knew the truth. The truth is that they wanted to deal with the Zone, find out what created it. That's why military stalkers were after them but they didn't know where to look. The government didn't want normal stalkers to know things they shouldn't have known. One day Strelok found something really important and made a move towards the centre of the Zone with some of his boys. Half of the group died on the way but the rest made it through... What happened to them there - no one knows. Looks like they've copped it. The other group members were caught and killed off... I don't think there are any of them left now. Sad story, eh?
Yeah... looks like someone really doesn't want the Zone to be understood...
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

The mercenaries are kind of like Freedom, only worse. At least Freedom have some ideals, but these dogs, they'll do anything for money. Someone really needs to kill them all before they drag something really dangerous out of the Zone into the normal world! They're based in the Pripyat and there's a sniper in every tall building, understand? They're not keen on strangers.
I see. Looks like you have to be careful in Pripyat.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

If you haven't been in the Arena, I'd recommend it - it's a good way to make money and show everyone what you can do. Not everyone has the balls to fight the next monster and that's a pity! Man, as soon as I save up enough cash for decent armour, I'm there.
What do you want?
Are you Baldy? I need to talk to you.
Suppose I am. What do you want?
Spotty got saved from the Red Forest, but Hunchback is dead.
Damn it!
Spotty is in bad shape, his brain doesn't work any more. Maybe you can talk to him? We need to find out the Scorcher's schedule.

No! Don't ask me to do this. Hunchback is dead because of me and what happened to Spotty is my fault too. I left them, betrayed them, deserted them and ran away! I can't look Spotty in the eyes after what I did!
Come on, chill out man. Tell me what happened.

The three of us were getting ready to try to get through to the North. We didn't know when the Scorcher emissions were lower but Spotty managed to get the information somewhere...I don't know where... We were half-way through the sector, when the Scorcher suddenly switched on again. Spotty passed out straight away and fell down the hillside. I panicked and said that we should leave everything and go back. Hunchback managed to pull himself together and said that we had to get Spotty out... I said "You're an idiot, don't you want to live? It's over for him, how are we going to carry him all the way back?" Just as he managed to convince me and started to climb down to get Spotty... another wave came. By the time I came to my senses I was by the military base... I thought Hunchback and Spotty stayed there... but Hunchback got him out and didn't make it himself... he got him out...
OK, Baldy, OK. Calm down, man. Thanks for telling me what happened. I'll talk to Spotty myself.
Sorry. I'm not in the mood for talking... I'd rather just have another drink...
What do you want?
What's new?

There was a guy... He had a lisp and walked with a stoop so he got the name Hunchback. He was a bit crazy...talked to himself and to animals... but apart from that, he was alright. He disappeared a long time ago in the centre with Strelok... they say Strelok is back now.
I wonder where he is now.
What do you want?
What's new?

The Wild Territory is infested with bloodsuckers now! They come out at night. I heard there's something really important at the factory that's nearby, something essential to someone. Duty sent some guys in there recently but they all died and their screams were heard kilometres away.
Thanks for the information.
What do you want?
What have you heard?

If you go around Lake Yantar you'll come to the scientists' camp - they do research of some sort there... They were dropped in by helicopter and they get regular supplies too. They've got a nice spot there really... You can deal with them too - they buy artefacts and might even give you a job to do.
Thanks for the information.
What do you want?
What have you heard?

Nobody has managed to get through the vehicle scrap yard because of the Brain Scorcher. Some people did see a stalker go through the invisible border, fall over, then get up in a couple of minutes and head straight for the centre of the scrap yards. He ain't been seen since...
Interesting...
What do you want?
What have you heard?

Missing stalkers come back from time to time. It's a scary sight, I tell you: they mumble something and reach for their weapons, which they lost somewhere... One came to a Duty outpost some time ago and a crowd gathered to look at him. Someone even recognized him... He was scary...red eyes, all bloodshot and bruised...couldn't say a word, just moaned like an animal and went around in circles. Duty took him in, but he died after a couple of days anyway. Something happens to people in the Zone, but what is it?
I'd like to know too.
What do you want?
What have you heard?

There are a lot of zombies around Lake Yantar. They wander around and attack any human they see. If you're spotted you might want to run for your life - there are too many of them former stalkers around there... They died at the lake and that's all that's left of them.
Yeah, I wouldn't want to join them.
What do you want?
What have you heard?

Traders say that there's a real treasure trove of artefacts in the centre of the Zone, so anyone who makes it through will make enough money for two lifetimes. Personally, I think there's more to this. Obviously the traders think about their own interests, but there are strange rumours going around. Apparently, there's something better than artefacts there - something that isn't from this world, something alien or from another dimension altogether! They call it the Wish-granting machine. I heard a legend about a stalker who made it through. Only every time someone makes a wish the Zone grows and nobody who gets there uses his wish to make it disappear. I guess when you get to the Machine you don't give a shit about anyone else.
That's sad.
What do you want?
What have you heard?

Everyone who believes in the Monolith is completely nuts. They keep banging on about it but nobody actually knows what's in the centre of the Zone. An invisible crystal that fell from the skies...ha-ha-ha! I reckon one of the secret labs blew up - I mean some stalkers used to work in a few of them. But, obviously, you can't bomb the Zone. Not only will the radiation spread all over the world, half of Europe would be flattened by the Zone's reaction. "Someone" has gone totally mad lately - I heard they're killing normal stalkers for no reason at all. How do you like that? Damn fanatics.
I think it deserves some attention.
I want to join Duty. What do I need to do?
Pay 1000 roubles. You'll get a pass. Take that to Voronin in the bunker and he'll arrange a test for you.
OK, here's the money.
Right, here is your pass. Go see Petrenko, the administrator. I've marked it on your map.
No, I changed my mind.
Your choice, man. See you.
Because there is no place for those Freedom bandits in the Zone - they must be destroyed. If you're interested, go ask Barkeep to explain everything. I'm busy.
Pay 1000 roubles and you'll get a pass. Take that to the Duty administrator and he'll arrange tests for you.
OK, here's the money.
Right, here is your pass. Go see Petrenko, the administrator. I've marked it on your map.
No, I changed my mind.
Your choice, man. See you.
Barkeep told me that your leader has some sort of assignment for me.

Yes, he let us know about you, but before we let you in I want to brief you on our rules. So listen, our rules are simple. First rule - it's forbidden to shoot on our territory. If you break the rule twice, our patrol will open fire on you. Even if you make a run for it, you won't appear on our territory again - our guards will make sure of that. If you act calmly, you won't have any problems.
Got it. Anything else?
Yes, that's enough. You can pass.
Got it. Anything else?

That's about it. If you want to try to join Duty, feel free. We need good men but I'm warning you: before being accepted, you'll have to do a few dangerous jobs. We don't need pussies so everyone is tested.
Halt! Outsiders aren't allowed in the Duty base!
What are you standing there for? Keep moving.
Go on, bro. Remember: Duty's mission is to cleanse.
Why don't you let outsiders in?
Where did you naive boys come from? There's a war going on, right? We're fighting Freedom bandits! We have regular skirmishes with their fighters in the Wild Territory.
A war with Freedom? Why?
Because there is no place for those Freedom bandits in the Zone - they must be destroyed. If you're interested, go ask Barkeep to explain everything. I'm busy.
Halt! Only members can go in there! We can't let you inside the bunker without a special pass. If you want to get one go see Colonel Petrenko. He's in the administration area across the yard.
What are you standing there for? Keep moving.
Go on. Remember: Duty's mission is to cleanse.
What do you want?
I'm listening.
Hello, friend.
What can I do for Duty?

That's a good question, Marked One and there's an equally good answer to it - kill Freedom anarchists. You'll get a reward for every PDA of theirs you bring and you might get promoted too. Take all the PDAs you get to Petrenko - he gives out the rewards.
Barkeep told me that you have some assignment for me at the Army Warehouses...

I want to ask you to do one thing, personally for me, you see? We're in the midst of territorial warfare with the Freedom faction and we need some weapons more powerful than what we have. Freedom has some excellent M202 flame throwers. If you could penetrate their territory and steal at least one such flame thrower, I would generously reward you. Since you aren't in our faction, you can quickly gain the trust of Freedom and, if you're lucky, get a hold of the M202.
Go on.

I'll upload the location of the Freedom base for you. You'll need to find their cook. He's a member of Freedom. He knows where the M202s are kept. And he likes his booze so bring a lot of vodka with you. So, what do you say?
OK, I'll try to steal the M202 from Freedom.

Oh, and one more thing. Colonel Skull and his boys disobeyed my order and decided to attack the Freedom base without authorization. Well, they can reap what they sow... suicidal bastards. Don't get involved in their fight. Just try to get me the flame thrower - nothing else matters.
I'm not ready for such exploits just yet.
That's up to you.
I'm ready to take the oath!
Well, Marked One. We won't forget what you did for us. Therefore, I am ready take you into Duty at any time to. Come when you will decide.
No, I'm not ready to serve Duty yet.
The war with Freedom is nearing its end, Marked One. You have contributed to our common cause, and now you can become a full member of Duty. Are you ready to take the oath?
I decided to join Duty after all, and I'm ready to take the oath!
Good man! Repeat after me: "I, a stalker known as Marked One, swear to defend the goals and ideals of Duty."
I, a stalker known as Marked One, swear to defend the goals and ideals of Duty.
To protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone, to seek out and destroy anything it spawns within and beyond its borders.
To protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone, to seek out and destroy anything it spawns within and beyond its borders.
To fight any nonconformists, be they individual stalkers or groups.
To fight any nonconformists, be they individual stalkers or groups.
And to give my life in the name of justice and order on Earth!
And to give my life in the name of justice and order on Earth!
Congratulations! You are now a full member of Duty.
I completed the mission. I brought the M202.

Good job, stalker. This is exactly what we need. Well, Marked One, you fulfilled my request, here's a reward for you. Also, I am ready now to take you into Duty. Are you ready to take the oath, Marked One?\n\n(ATTENTION! Joining the Duty group cannot be undone, and this action effectively cuts you off from Freedom quests.)
I'm listening.
What brings you here, brother?
You brought the 202?
Yes, here is the 202.

Good job, stalker. This is exactly what we need. Well, Marked One, you fulfilled my request, here's a reward for you. Also, I am ready now to take you into Duty. Are you ready to take the oath, Marked One?
What brought you to me, brother?
The war with Freedom is coming to an end, Marked One. You played your part in fighting for the cause and now I want to finish this war. I want you to kill the Freedom leader.

What brings you here, brother? You killed the leader of those Freedom anarchists and their group has crumbled. The war is not over but its outcome is certain. Your achievements are great and they will not be forgotten.
Hello, stalker. Join Duty! We need good fighters! I only joined recently and look at the cool uniform they gave me!
Hello, Marked One. I'm glad you're with us. Duty is really going to need good fighters soon.
Hey, fellow stalker.
Tell me about Duty.

We've been here since the beginning. The first group was made up of the surviving members of special units sent into the Zone to find out what caused it to appear. We found ourselves in pretty dire circumstances. After half of the unit died horribly, those who survived swore that they wouldn't leave here until they understood what is going on in the Zone... until they defeat it.
Tell me about Freedom.

They're thugs who don't understand that the Zone is an ulcer on Earth's body. They want to spread it all over the world, a piece in every household. They'll do anything to achieve that goal and I can't wait to put an end to it.
You want to defeat the Zone?
Yes and we managed to a large degree. During the cleaning operations, whole swarms of mutants on the way to the Zone's centre were destroyed.
Thank you.
I'm listening.
How can I help?
Hello brother! What brings you to me?
What do you want?
Go on, keep moving. What are you staring at?
Hey man! I'm glad you haven't been eaten by mutants yet.
There was a massacre by the outpost. What happened?

That's the remnants of the last wave of mutants that came before the blowout. It's quiet for three or four days and then there's another wave. If not for us, there'd be no Bar, there'd be no Duty; we're the last barrier in the way of these crazy mutants. A lot of our boys met their end here.
I would like to know something.
What do you want to know?
It's my first time here. Could you tell me a little about this place?

Before the accident in '86 this was an industrial area. As you can see, there isn't much left of it now... In the basement by the hangar you'll find the 100 Rads bar. The place is run by the local trader who doubles up as a barman. If you want to trade, talk, get a mission or find out the latest news, that's the place to go. There's also the Arena where you can fight and make some cash. Duty's base is not far from the Arena. If you want to join Duty go straight over there - they'll tell you who to speak to. Oh, by the way, all of this area is protected by Duty so behave and keep your weapons holstered. If you start shooting, the patrol will "calm you down" pretty quickly.
You said there's a bar here. Can you tell me where exactly it is?
In the basement behind the hangar...I'll mark it on your map.
Thanks for the information.
You said the Duty base is here. How do I get to it?
It's not far from the Arena. I've marked it on the map for you.
Thanks for the information.
You said there's an Arena here? Where exactly is it?
Go out of the hangar with the broken roof and you'll end up right in front of it. I'll mark it on your map.
Thanks for the information.
Thanks for the information.
I'm here on business.
I take it you want something from me.
I shot down a pig on my way here. They say it's a valuable one.
I heard you shot Borov. You deserve to get some cash and a decent gun for that. Do your new weapon justice!
Don't you worry about that.
I had a little "chat" with Tyran of Freedom. Basically, he understood his mistake and promised to behave in the future. I'm pretty sure he won't be breaking his word - the dead don't lie.
Tyran was a real pain in the ass for us! I'm glad you terminated him. Here is your reward - an S14 Thunder, our trademark weapon.
Not bad. I'm off to do more of the same. See you.
Didn't Voronin tell you anything?
Wow, congratulations! It's quite an achievement to kill Freedom's leader. Man, I wish I was as tough as you.
Get plenty of exercise, eat your veggies, and listen to your mother. Thanks for the new equipment. I'm off.
I'd like to know something.
What do you want to know?
Who are you and how did you end up here?

My name is Kruglov. I am a professor of biology, I study the Zone. Yesterday, for example, I found an animal of particular interest - Anthropomorphous Dendroctonus Vulgaris. I mostly find and document new species of mutant animals, their traits and distinctive features. The information is then thoroughly studied and transferred to the outside world. Some of it, of course, goes to Barkeep. My discoveries have helped to save the lives of many stalkers. I was just transporting the results of my latest research to the laboratory near Lake Yantar when the helicopter came under fire.
Tell me about the Zone.

The Zone is a wonderful gift to humanity. Of course normal existence here is not possible due to the high radiation levels, and aggressive mutants. All of these things are obviously extremely dangerous but they are also things of great scientific value. The Zone is almost a natural experiment, a treasure for scientists! The extent to which humanity's knowledge could be increased through the study of the Zone is unfathomable. Technology, medicine, new plants- medical and edible, biotechnology, cures for incurable diseases...anything! Perhaps we can solve the food problem for the entire planet. If people didn't interfere, science could lead humanity into a new Golden Era!
Duty thinks otherwise and even Freedom doesn't seem to want to help you.
They're simply incapable of grasping the whole picture. Their "here and now" problems are far more important to them than the future of humanity!
Maybe there is some use in studying the Zone.

So you understand that too? It's wonderful to discover that there are those among you who are not narrow-minded practical people. I've always said it's important to look at the whole set of issues from a broader perspective, to distance ourselves from the simple human measures. Even if the Zone has done harm to humanity, it can still be of great use to us!
Why are the mercenaries looking for this information?

I hope this doesn't offend you, but many stalkers are like children. They are seriously affected by things they find out. Just think of all these legends about a Monolith that grants wishes. What a joke! The problem is that these children play their games with real weapons and cause death. Childish people are often annoyed about the fact that someone doesn't share everything with them, including information that is not meant for them. There are no limits in the use of force. They shoot without thinking and kill those who study the Zone. They believe that this information will allow them to open the way to the centre of the Zone. They're fools, dangerous and naive fools!
I am looking for the X16 Lab. Could you tell me where it is?
Lab X16? Hmm... Sakharov mentioned something of the sort in passing but I do not recall exactly what he said. Perhaps it's best to ask him yourself... He's currently in the mobile lab by Lake Yantar.
Unfortunately I have to go. Good luck.
Marked One, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. I'll deal with them.
Okay.
Let's move. We'll try to break through...
Let's hurry up.

Stalker, I'm begging you! We were returning from Yantar when the mercenaries shot down our helicopter. I heard that they are looking for information but I know they'll kill us. Help me get to the lake and I'll tell you everything I know about what you call the Brain Scorcher. Barkeep will pay you well.
Well, let's go, I'll get you there.
Thank you, stalker. I am not much of a fighter but I know the way so I'll lead and you cover us.
No. Try to get out of here yourself.
No. I am sure you don't mean that. I'll never make it out of here alone. If you change your mind, I'll be here...if I live.
Hurry, we have to get out of here quickly.

Phew! Have we really made it to safety? At last! Thank you so much for your help. I am in your debt but for now please accept this flash drive. It contains the results of my latest expedition. I am sure the Barkeep would pay well for it.
Yes, we're here.
Marked One, if you visit our mobile laboratory at Yantar, we will give you a scientific suit.
We'll see.
Hello, stalker. Allow me to express my gratitude on behalf of global science!
Marked One, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. I'll deal with them.
Okay.
Let's move. We'll try to break through...
Let's go.
Marked One, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. I'll deal with them.
OK, I'll wait here.
Let's move. We'll try to break through...
OK, let's hurry.
Be careful with the Burner anomaly, Marked One. My suit will protect me but you'd best avoid it.
Thanks for your advice.
Hurry, Marked One. Now is not the time to talk.
Stalker, talk with Professor Kruglov, help him get out.
It's over. They killed Kruglov!

Rather crappy actually. However, that's none of your business. It's better to have a beer than tempt fate. This is the Zone after all: I was returning after selling my loot - it's a miracle I came back alive - I could have caught a bullet from one of the patrols - it was sheer luck, and all the rest - is history...
1 Yes, and today - it's on the house. Just bear in mind, the first toast goes to Shining!
For whom?
Have you never heard of Shining?
No, never... Who is he?

Oh, Marked One! This is the only stalker in the Zone, who cared for others. He gave money to those that were robbed of their loot by bandits, and even buy them drinks. One day he came to me and said that he was leaving to join the monolith, and asked me to pray for his happiness. He left me all his money and artefacts. He said that if he didn't return the following week for his property, to use it to treat the stalkers beer. Well, I treating you.
I've heard of him now... Let's have a beer!
Yes, in respect. Let's drink!
Here you are.
Listen buddy, I have some very valuable information for your commander, can you let me pass?

In principle it's possible, but quid pro quo. I need you to do something, Marked One. I urgently needed an accurate and completely silent weapon. Namely, a crossbow. Can you bring me this thing? I know for sure that there's one in those Freedom asshole's armoury. Will you be able to steal it?
You're... Okay, wait, I'll get you that shit.
You're... Forget it, I won't do it.
Hi, sergeant. You haven't forgotten our arrangement?
Don't worry, I didn't forget. Have you fulfilled your part of the bargain?
Yeah I got it. It wasn't easy.
Well, that's how it goes. Thanks for getting it, it's an excellent piece! Come on in - don't just stand there.
You know a lot of things, but is there something useful you can tell me about the Zone?
For you, the "hero", there is. I'm sure this information will be very useful to you in the future. He-he. But is it really very expensive. Ready to give up about fifty grand?
Wow! Okay, take it, I'm sure it's worth the money.
You expect me to pay that sort of money for a cat in a bag? Go take a deep breath!

So listen. Barkeep often has customers aren't too keen to come into Duty territory. So, there is a small wormhole leading straight into his storeroom. A stalker named Physicist created it. How? I don't know, so don't ask, Physicist was obviously smarter than all these nerds put together. You'll find the entrance to the wormhole at the back of the Bar, where nobody goes.
Thank you, I'll go look for. That's really useful information.
I'm looking for a stalker who recently came to you.
All sorts come to me...
They call him One-eyed.
Yes, he was here a couple of days ago.
What did he buy and where did he go then?
He bought a lot of things, but exactly what - I won't tell you, sorry. All of a sudden, are you a gun-runner or a mugger? If I remember correctly, he left in the direction of Army Warehouses.
Well, thanks for that.
I'm listening.
Well, hello, homeboy! I've been looking for you for sometime.
Hi. We know each other?
Of course, we only have the same motherland - the Zone, you motherfucker! How are you?
Quietly. What do you want?
I know why you came here. You came, to find someone. I am a friend of One-eyed, the one you're looking for.
Where's Radioman, Owl and Chatterbox?
There all sitting in a safe place, I was sent here to find you, well, to pick up Veteran's flash drive.
Wait, are you sure you're his friend?
Well, who else's, blah?
Then answer me this question: out of five of you, who divided the map into five parts? If you really are who you say you are, you should know the answer.
How should I know? Give me the flash drive, and I'll deliver it to the appropriate person.
I don't have it to give.
In that case, go on the road to the Army Warehouses, there, in the bushes right around the corner, One-eyed is waiting for you.
Good...
Hey, man! In two words, can you?
Well, let's go.
How about some dice?
Come on. "Under and Over", let's do it. For how much shall we play?
For 200 roubles.
For 500 roubles.
For 1000 roubles.
For booze.
For artefacts.
Well, let's go! Throw the dice.
~ROLL THE DICE~
What artefact will you bet?
Stone Blood
Meat Chunk
Soul
Slug
Slime
Mica
Jellyfish
Stone Flower
Night Star
Sparkler
Flash
Moonlight
Wrenched
Gravi
Goldfish
Thorn
Crystal Thorn
Sea Urchin
Droplets
Fireball
Crystal
Throw the dice!
~ROLL THE DICE~
Well, you woke up? Now then, you better come to your senses if you want to get your ass out of here in one piece!
Oh, damn it!
This is personally from me to you. Come on tell me who you are and where you come from!
You can go to hell with your questions!
All right, wait, I'll tell you everything major...
What did you hit me for no reason, no reason at all?
I see that you didn't understand my question. Okay, I'll ask you again, but more clearly this time...
Fuck you! You posing as an investigator, huh?
I'm not an investigator, I'm the head of interrogation, in accordance with the Charter and Service Guide of the Duty faction!
Well, what the hell does your group want with me?
You tried to rob our field arsenal full of equipment our soldiers prepared for a raid! Who gave you the coordinates of the cache? Answer me!
What cache? It was just a box in plain view!
You don't say! Don't try to teach us, how to operate in the Zone... I'll ask you once again: Who told you about the location of our field arsenal?
I'll tell you: would you believe, I stumbled upon it, by chance?

Well, of course! Tell me more: "I am a stalker, I like to hang around on different back streets and crawl into any dirty place"... Stop lying! We learned about your plans to rob our arsenal, in ADVANCE. I advise you not to deny it - you will be hurt!
"Learned" from whom? What kind of nonsense is this?
This conversation, is starting to bore me. I'll give you one last chance: tell me who gave it to you!
What are you talking about? This is some sort of set-up!

According to the Charter of the Duty group, namely section 25 "Code for maintaining law and order in the Zone"; in the name of the law, I sentence you to death for the theft of assets having strategic importance, belonging to Duty. The sentence will be carried out immediately. I will personally supervise the execution.
What kind of bullshit is this?
I'm not going to stand for the next half an hour! Stop wasting my time and quickly answer my questions!
What happened, Major? I don't remember anything, my head is pounding...
Good acting, you fucking spy! Answer me, why did you try to clean out our cache?
Well, I didn't know that it was yours! I stumbled on a box and looked in...
"... out of curiosity?" Don't lie, you bastard! You heard the message from our checkpoint! Who sent you, answer me!
No one! I wander the Zone alone, collecting artefacts...

Yeah, for sure! "I'm an honest loner; I'm like - a golden haired boy!" Don't anger me, it will make it worse for you! Keep in mind that we were told in advance that you planned to plunder our property from the arsenal! I'll give you one last chance: either you answer who told you about our operational arsenal, or be sentenced to death!
Wait a minute, I need to remember... My head is ringing like a bell...
Aha! Tell me more: "I probably have amnesia, I need to go to the hospital at first"... You better remember soon, I'm getting impatient!

I remember! I came across a dead man on the path to the northern checkpoint. Suddenly, three bandits pounced on me! I took them out, and one of them had a PDA with the coordinates of your box. That's the way it was, I swear.
What nonsense are you talking?
I'm telling the truth! Send some soldiers there, and let them report back what they find.

Hmm, Nalivaiko spoke to me this morning about some types in cloaks that were loitering near his post... This will happen: we probably won't shoot you this time, because I need to personally attend an execution, and I have a bursting hang-over after yesterday's celebrations... Well, your weapons will be confiscated as compensation for the theft, and you need to get out of here. I don't want to see you in the Bar for a maximum of five hours, okay?! ? If you return earlier, I've given the order to shoot to kill! Clear?
It couldn't be clearer...
You've been arrested for robbery of our group's field arsenal and disrupting an important campaign. Confess, who are you working for?
What robbery? What campaign? I don't understand what you mean...
Here's a little bit of information! Do you want to be charged? Any wiser? Now do you begin to understand?
Shit! What are you on about? I don't work for anybody, I'm a loner...
Why have you robbed our cache, bitch? Speak, or I'll strangle you with my own hands!
Calm down, major! I'll tell you!
Quickly, you have three minutes! I'm in a shitty mood today, I don't want to hear the rest!
I didn't rob it! I just wanted to take a flash drive out of the box...
What kind of flash drive?
A flash drive with a piece of a map... Where I can find the Klondike artefact...
Where did you get it? Speak up, or I'll shoot you! There are no witnesses, I'll feed your remains to the mutants! Talk fast!
So much for Duty... I learned about the map which is divided into five parts, from a wounded stalker at the Cordon, and these parts - are on five flash drives. This - is one of them..
Don't badmouth duty, you reptile! Yeah, interesting stuff happens under the very eyes. So, I need to think... Sit there and don't move, okay? I'll be back soon.
Okay, whatever you say.
Come on, give me the flash drive the flash drive. I will use it as evidence.
No! I'm not giving it!
Yes, of course...
You bastard, don't you understand? Quickly, give me the flash drive, or you will die!
Here, choke on it!
Thank you.

Well, that's all. Now sit a little, I'll take care of our patients, and try to get them on their feet. Oh, and Marked One - thank you very much. You helped me a lot, this artefact had to be found. As a reward, you can keep the protective suit, it can still be useful to you, and here, take these artefacts - the sick stalkers gave them to us when they asked for our help.
(rolls up sleeve)

I have a certain amount of SQ109, it's generally an anti-TB drug, but it also shows great efficiency against this type of bacteria, your infection has not developed fully yet, first we will prick you - it will provide a better chance of success. Roll up your sleeve, Marked One.
What will you do?

It's like this. Just as I thought. This artefact is actively live and breeding methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus. This organism possesses resistance to almost all modern antibiotics. Here we have some new species that is very active, quickly attacking the body, causing a rapidly progressive pneumonia.
Well, what is it?
Excellent. Now I will take a swab from the artefact, apply it on a test strip and check everything... So, I see...
Here, take it.
Well then, I'll just have to make three doses, one of them for you. Give me the container with the artefact.
I don't know, maybe. I am feeling a bit shitty.
Remarkably, just in time... Oh, you don't look very well Marked One. Have you been infected?
Doctor, I've found and brought the artefact.
Okay, I'll try. Apparently he couldn't have gone far.
Glad to help guys.
Better, more or less. Thank you, Marked One, without you, we definitely would have died.
Well, how do you feel?

Well, it seems he went to the Dark Valley, he was very pleased with himself, and probably was going to boast about his prize. Try to go there, judging by how quickly the guys started getting sick, this thug couldn't have lasted long.
Damn, how will I find him now?

Shit, so it's because of that... Now I understand, how it happened... We were on our way to the Bar with a bag of artefacts. Near the entrance, Vasya Katchalov, a local criminal, bailed us up. I didn't want to hand it over, I'm not really a fighter, and the guys were already unable to even lift up their arms. In short, I gave him this artefact so he would leave us alone. Bloody hell, he's probably dead by now, if this artefact is causing the disease. So, it's necessary to find this nit.
Well, it looks like your guys are sick because of it. It carries a dangerous infection. Where is it now?
What about it?
Hey, about this strange artefact...
Is there really someone not afraid to visit us?
Who are you? Why do sit here and not in the Bar?

Why, aren't you aware? I thought, everybody at the Bar knew... These stalkers are sick. I want to warn you: They are struck down with an infection unknown to science, so accordingly, there is no vaccine against it. If you value your life, you'd better get out of here as soon as possible if you do not want to catch it yourself!
Thank you for your concern. Aren't you afraid of getting infected?
Oops! Got it, just leaving!

I'm - a scientist. The life of the scientist doesn't belong to him, it belongs to science... I specialize in microbiology, I study the framework of the mutations of viruses and bacteria under the influence of anomalous fields and intense radioactive exposure in the Zone. These stalkers - are a unique case, they must be studied. In addition, I may be also able to help them even. Well, you can't underestimate how important an accurate observation of the course of the disease and the description of the symptoms, will be to science! Of course, Dr.Gorbovsky was more deeply involved in the study of this disease, I was only his assistant... And frankly, I just don't know what to do now! Without the doctor, I wouldn't be able to finish the studies or cure these two patients.
Where is Dr.Gorbovsky?

Oh, the news about him is not good! I think, he was kidnapped by mercenaries! Perhaps they confused him for Professor Sakharov, because there are some similarities between them... The doctor was abducted three days ago, and a ransom note was sent. The amount asked by the kidnappers, is huge! So... I don't know what to do. Had he not been kidnapped, he most certainly would have managed to create a cure for this disease.
Why didn't you seek help from Duty, for example?

Because I wasn't allowed to go to Duty! They were afraid that I was infected by my patients. If not for me, these poor creatures would have been shot long ago! These poor men are in a terrible state, they rave about a Klondike Artefact...
I think that I should deal with these mercenaries.
I doubt very much that there is something you can do, they looked like a team of well trained professionals.
Just give me their coordinates, and I'll take a look. Maybe I'll come up with something.
But you can't cope with them alone! Perhaps, you should ask for help! The mercenaries are in the Darkscape. At least, that's where we were told to bring the ransom.
Clear. Another question: How much time do I have?
I think that patients will last another 2 days at the most. But in any case - good luck!
Thank you. Take care of yourself!
I'm not contagious, don't shoot me!
Why are you sitting there?
Why are you so confident that you're not sick?

I was at the Garbage with the Falcon and Tikhon! They're just about to kick the bucket, but I feel fine. The doctor looks after them, and I drag food from Bar and drive the away dogs. Perhaps, some fresher guys will come.
Tell me, what were you up when you unearthed this?

They found some hole in one of garbage heaps and made a cache there. Then they decided to return in a few months, and a few weeks ago - they asked me to accompany them, so I agreed. I had to climb into this hole, with a bag of artefacts - there was even a rare one, I never even heard of! And then, as began to return to the Bar, the guys began to get sick, - I practically had to drag them the last few metres. I thought, they would receive treatment here, but it never happened...
Well?

Duty they saw them, coughing and spitting blood, they trained their guns at us and ordered us to leave. "Don't bring your diseases here!" - they said. Well, it's good that someone noticed and called the doctor, not that he could help us!
Interesting story.
I beg you, just don't make noise!
What's the matter?
Shush! Quiet, please!... Otherwise, it will hear us...
What will? Why don't you go back to Malyshev instead of sitting here?
I was on my way to the poor sick fellows, but some animal picked up my scent! I hide here and sit and wait - maybe it will go away?
Hardly. I'll make it "go away".
Doctor, I took care of the bloodsucker. Can we go now?

So, it was a bloodsucker? I'll make sure to record in my diary the strange sounds these creatures emit while on the hunt... Yes, of course! Let's go to the sick right now! I hope they are still alive.
You were almost just eaten, and you talk about... "Amusing sounds"... Okay, let's go.
Well, how are you doing here?

Excellent! Well, now the doctor is here again, we definitely will be able to find a vaccine and to overcome the disease! This is extremely important! Just think, what would happen in the long term - if it broke out of the Zone? A search for a vaccine - is a matter of life and death for all mankind! It's not a simple matter, so I'm glad you rescued the doctor!
Thank you. Happy to help!
Well, what can you do?

Where have you been?... The poor wretches died in agony. Now it's too late - it's most likely, a cure for the disease, will not be found now! It can now break out of the Zone! You have no idea what this threat, is to all mankind!
I pity the poor fellows. Hopefully this disease... will not spread.
Doctor, what is your diagnosis?

Um, well... I think it makes sense to share some thoughts with you. First of all, I want to note that on the basis of my observations, that we can conclude that the infection is not transmitted from person to person, at least - not by airborne droplets. That is, we have practically nothing to fear. I found this out before I was kidnapped by the mercenaries.
Then why such a fuss?

You see, the situation will not become less critical. I have every reason to believe that the first victim, was a stalker who came into contact with a certain anomalous body, which was an artefact or something like that.
What prompted you to come to this conclusion?

I spoke to their assistant - the rookie, who protects us. What he said, confirmed my long-standing suspicion of the existence of a "artefact-hive" or in simple words - an artefact that serves as an incubator and as a consequence, is a breeding ground for harmful micro organisms that are likely to mutate and are capable of causing a certain number of dangerous diseases in humans. A long time ago, I put forward a theory of the existence of such an artefact, based on the analysis of various artefacts that impact on the development of strains of some diseases known to science.
Wow, an artefact! Hopefully, if it exists, it's the only one!

I hope so too, it's indirectly evidenced by the absence of reported epidemics among stalkers; dysentery is not counted. However, my information needs to be checked. This is what I'm getting at: to definitively prove my theory, I need to find the artefact, and study it. Are you ready to go on a quest?
But what about the patients, what will happen to them?
Don't worry, I have drugs that hinder the development of the disease. However, we can only manufacture the vaccine if we have this "Beehive" artefact, do you understand?
Let me think about it.
I am ready to go!

Well, Marked One! Then start by talking with the man who dragged those guys here. He must know where to find this artefact - they came here without it. I mentioned something about a criminal at the Garbage, try to find out where to look for him. You'll need a protective suit and a special container, as soon as you find it - immediately place it in the container and bring it to me, I already know, what to do with it. But don't try to handle the artefact without a protective suit, Marked One, it would end badly for you. Be sure to wear it before you pick it up. And don't remove the suit until you bring me the artefact, I'm not convinced of the integrity of the container.
Okay, I understand.
Are you having problems?
Apart from you, no.
Stop joking... I'm serious.

You see that safe in the corner? I've lost lost the combination for it. During my last inventory it seems I found a piece of paper with the combination for the safe, but my batman - that drunken beast lost my briefcase with this piece of paper. It seems he lost it nearby - in the hangar at the entrance to our base, but everyone is afraid to search for it. The hangar doors are locked, you will have to go through the roof. Can you open the safe? I'll owe you one.
Any ideas what the combination could be?
Generally zero. I tried to use 1,2,3, but that didn't work.
Of course. Is there something of value inside?
I don't remember. I need it, to store weapons and ammunition. What about it?
I'll do it.
Nope.
The safe is open.
Well done! The combination, what is it?
432. It's tricky, of course, but you better change it.
I'll change it, I'll change it. What was in there? If you're honest, you'll get a good reward.
Nothing, it was empty.
Well, some junk, a young stalker's gear.
Okay, fuck it. Here's a reward - it's not much:
Yeah, it's real junk. Okay, hand it over, you can keep the book, it's of no use to me.
Wait, what about the reward?
Here, take it.
Colonel, do you want the briefcase?
Are you kidding? You found it? Give it here.
Let's assume I won't just give it up, and you give me five pieces.
Consider this a normal business deal. Take your five pieces.
Here you go, I don't mind.
You're a good man, Marked One. Here, take a few grenades, they'll come in handy.
Your men stripped me of everything, they even threw me in jail.
Who exactly are you accusing?
Major Zhivoderov.
Ah, you know him... intelligent fellow. Neither the one you've identified nor any of his men would beat you. Anyway, he's at a meeting today and has already told me everything.
But I wasn't going to steal anything! Something of mine was in that box!
