Well, who do think I should believe: the son of a colleague, whom I know from childhood, or you? It's like that. If you really want your confiscated goods returned, I'll give you a chance to prove that they are really yours.
I don't need to prove to Duty, what is, or isn't mine...
Well, do you want to get your stuff back or not?
Of course I do.

Then listen carefully to what I have to say. The fact is, this area itself is neutral territory. Anyone who calls themselves stalkers can come here and trade, except only the most obvious thugs for whom there's a reward on their heads, and, of course, Freedom... So, there is a problem. A bandit named Caligula has appeared in the Zone recently. At first he traded what little trifle he could steal from the rookies at the Cordon, and then he decided to pull in the "big fish" - he hammered together a gang and started to attack our squads. He'd grab their equipment and loot and the prisoners were sometimes tortured, but more often, they'd be shoot. We started to hunt for him and killed all his accomplices, but we never got Caligula.
You didn't have enough men?
Don't interrupt! In short, it's not so simple dealing with this skinhead. The fact is, Caligula has the nerve to come here, to the Bar, drink here and even sell goods stolen from our soldiers!
How can this happen?

Very simple: Barkeep has some secret agreement with him. We can't just arrest the bandit while he's in the Bar - Barkeep would be offended. He could survive without us, his main clientele - are stalkers with artefacts, we need him more than he needs us... In general, this Caligula is really ruining our lives, and even mocking us. You have to kill him, Marked One.
So General, you have decided to make me your proxy. What if Barkeep gets wind of the deal?
He won't get wind. You have to arrange everything as if it were your own doing, you understand?
Not really...

You need to somehow offend or insult this Caligula, so he'll challenge you to showdown. Shooting in the Bar is strictly forbidden, therefore you'll have to deal with him in the Arena. That's where you can safely kill him. Nobody will suspect anything.
Okay. Where can I find Caligula?
No, I won't do it.
He'll be in the 100 Rads Bar. Go and do it, if the bandit dies - you get your things back safely.
Where did you get the idea, watching Mad Max movies?
No, why do you ask?
The story is similar... Okay, here goes nothing.
And who are you?
Oh, just looking.
I know your face from somewhere...
So, get the fuck out of here.
What did you say?
I just remembered, you're the local idiot named Vaska Rooster... Well piss off, your place is in the hen house!
Oh you bitch, you're dead meat! Right, let's go to the Arena now, and sort this out!
Come on, I'll pluck out your feathers.
Choose, scumbag, which weapon do you want to use: pistols, sawn-off shotguns or knives?
Pistols.
Knives.
Sawn-off shotguns.
What now, general? Caligula is dead.
Stalker, I'm very grateful, but listen...
Let me guess: my things are gone to cover expenses?
Nothing went nowhere, just wait...
Did Barkeep find out about our affairs?
No. Zhivoderov got into trouble! He has your stuff.
What happened with him? I'm only interested purely, because he has my stuff.
Got into some garbage and now is doomed. My soldiers are trying to get him out, but to no avail.
Just like in the fairy tale, "The Giant Turnip"?
Consider this, Zhivoderov is the only who knows the location of your items. And if you save the major, you'll also get a reward from me.
I'll help him.
To hell with your major.

Well, I see that you're a real man! An orderly told me about five minutes ago that the major had found something dangerous in the old cracked tower, right across from our base. He's trapped in there as if inside an anomaly. Help him, stalker, he's very valuable to me! My soldiers are there, but for some reason, they can do nothing. Go to him!
Well, as you wish, stalker...
You're from the General?
Yes, what happened?

This, is the problem: the Major entered this fucking tower, but now, he can't get out. I've called and called him, and he doesn't come. Then private Brill went in after him but also, never returned. I went in after Brill, but he was not breathing. If we can't rescue the Major, the General will tear off my skin. Be a man - help me save the Major.
If the private is dead, what makes you think that the Major is still alive?
Listen. You can hear moans coming from the top of the tower.
Did you try wearing a suit with psi-protection?
I tried, but the stupid suit failed, it didn't work!
Fuck knows what to do now.
And who are you?
I'm the one who knows how to get out the Duty soldier out of the tower.
You do?
I hope you believe what I tell what that extortionist brought on to himself. That bastard tried to rummage through my stash.
Go on.

I returned to the Bar from Yantar, to have a drink and relax, using the money from the proceeds of my loot. This Zhivoderov, drunk as a lord comes up to me and says, he and his men are guarding me from the bandits, so I should pay him protection money. I ask: "Can I use my loot as payment?" He said that I could. I then told him about my cache in the top tier of the tower. In there, I hid a single unknown artefact, and something else. To the scientists, this artefact was worthless, because it didn't have any properties, but I figured that before the Major worked out what's what, I'd be gone from the Bar.
Zhivoderov fell for it. So what happened then?
He climbed the tower and left his men on lookout. Then they tried to pull him out, but failed. And then you came along... Were you instructed to save him?
Yes. You said that you know how to do it.

It's necessary to disable the scientific device that he took out of my cache. You see, in addition to the artefact, I also hid an unknown device there, that I stole from the scientists. What are you looking at? They can order a new one, for the price of a pack of smokes... So: I didn't touch the device, I just put it in there. Apparently, the Major rummaged through my cache for the artefact and came across the device and switched it on out of curiosity - and now it's affecting his brain. It's necessary to turn it off, then the field will be gone.
Why is the Major still alive, and his assistant has died?
Fuck knows, maybe because every brain is different. My stalker instinct suggests that this artefact he took from my cache, is somehow protecting him.
Maybe. What do you advise?

It's necessary to switch off the device! There is something else. Although... I have an idea. While I was at the Cordon my friend Tolik, gave me a bottle of the locally brewed moonshine. He said they called it "Kordonovsky". This bastard, packs a punch - it will really numb your brain! So So I'm thinking: fight fire with fire, as they say: drink it and rush to the device. The main thing - is to stall for time, before your brain begins to boil. Well, what will it be?
I don't drink!
Come on, it can't hurt.
H-help me! Turn it off!
Wait a second!
Look, how do I turn off this damn device?
I wish I knew. There was a manual, but the instructions were so complicated that I used the pages for cigarette papers.
Well, you blockhead! How am I going to turn it off?
Wait, calm down. Before I used it all up, I did read something.
Tell me, what did you understand.

Although I'm not an electrician, I did realize something. The manual mentioned something about an overload: it said, to prevent it, a certain button must not be depressed, or the specific device will burn out.
There's a lot of buttons.

This is what I remember about what was written: "... for the correct maximum load output it's necessary to press down the buttons alternately, increase the power of the first phase, then go to the second phase alternately pressing all the buttons, except the last one." So, if you click the last button, it will overload.
Apparently, it's necessary to press three side buttons in turn, and then click the lower left button, then go back and press all three side buttons again?
Are you asking me? I don't actually know. It's just what I read...
If not for your greedy hands, this problem wouldn't exist. However, it's in my best interests, to save the Duty soldier in the tower.
Listen, do you know how to turn off the unit in the tower?
Nah. If I had studied engineering in Kiev, as my parents had always wanted me to, maybe I could suggest something.
The Major is safe, I shut down the device.

Well, thank you, stalker! Listen... Can you tell the General that I helped a little, well a teeny bit, in saving the Major in the tower? He might give me a new weapon, or maybe, award me with a medal.
I understand.
Any orders?
What fucking orders, I have a splitting headache... let's get out of here.
Okay.
I rescued your Major.

Stalker, you - a real man! I understand your desire to get even with him, what he did to you - was a personal insult. Because you proved yourself by your actions, I now know that you would not steal from Duty caches. By the way, how did it go with Caligula?
I guess I know why your soldiers couldn't overcome him: he had an artefact with strong protective properties.
It's alright now, he'd dead and can't hurt anyone else.

Stalker, I ... I mean our group needs this artefact! We need to pass it on to the scientists, this will help them in the development of protective combat armour. Sell it to me. I give a hundred thousand.
Then get a reward from both me, and Zhivoderov:
Not enough.
I agree.
Don't be arrogant, that's 10 times more than any rare artefact of that category is worth!
It has properties that makes it worth more.
One hundred thousand and our top body armour.
No deal.
A hundred thousand, our top suit and a machine gun with a hundred rounds of ammunition.
That's quite another matter.
Don't take me for a sucker.
Agreed!
Well then, piss off out of here with that rock! I thought you were an honest man, but you're just a huckster.
I hope your head has cleared enough, so you can remember where you put my stuff?
Enough... Besides your belongings, take this artefact in gratitude:
Thank you.
Greetings to you, stalker.
Are you Tail? Tell where to find one your friend, Kolya.
What a smart-ass. And what is it you need from him?
I was asked by Chebu... Uh-uh, I owe him some money, I want to give it back.
Ah, Stalker, you can keep your money. I don't think you'll find Kolya.
Why's that? Did something happened to him?

He went to the north. Not to Freedom, but to undiscovered places. He was constantly tormented, and frequently had nightmares. He was always muttering about the creatures of the Zone, calling them astral beings, the quintessence of the human information field. In general, nonsense. Poor guy... No one really understood him, I thought he went crazy during one of his campaigns. But I saw that in his mind, he really believed it. That subject - we never talked about. Then one day, he packed up and left. He said nothing to anyone, just whispered to me in parting: "I must find him, he will be THERE again, I know it."
Who was he looking for?
I don't know. Well, whoever it was, he'll never return from those places.
And where was he going?

To the north, that's all I can say. Only the locals and Kolya know where it is. There are legends about that place, it's called the Dead City. It's dangerous out there, life is worth more than any artefact. Don't think about going there to look for him - you'll disappear as well.
Well, as you can see, I'm not a rookie.
No, you're not a novice, you're a fool. But why should I care? Go wherever you want.
Hmm, thank you for your encouraging words.

Hey, stalker, don't be offended. It's a bad idea - to go after him. But if you've decided, it's your business. If you find him and are able to return - be kind and respectful, let me know if he's alive.
I found Kolya.
Judging by the expression on your face, I fear for the worst.
Yeah, he was killed in the Dead City.
So, that's where he went alone. Yes, he liked to take risks. Well, God rest his soul... Did he find what he was looking for?
I doubt it. I found nothing unusual on him.
It's a pity. Well, stalker, thank you for coming. Kolya left a little money with me to look after. He no longer needs it, so you can can have it.
How are the valiant soldiers of the Zone?

Well, I'll tell you... We received an order from the mainland - to test an all-purpose weapon. Supposedly, "to fine tune this universal tactical machine of the future to operate under simulated combat conditions." They're bent. What will they use as a simulation - shooting of wild boars at the military post or something? So, here a good old AK-74 will suffice. However, I have an order - so I must obey. The guns look interesting enough, like a normal AK, but it has so many features, that it will blow your mind. Just the sights alone. The boxes of equipment were sent - in the darkness! And I, as usual, am still slowly selling gear to stalkers, I promote, so to speak, unification, he-he. Why don't you take one, and then, in the blink of an eye, you will have a new AK to go. You won't be ridiculed for having a dated weapon.
